chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.)

result.execSummary:
The defendant James Robert Walters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James Robert Walters is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James Robert Walters was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • James Robert Walters was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
10:46 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 amended to misdemeanor Possession of THC with a fine and costs and will plea to count 3 and count 2 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Johnson concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as amended and finds the defendant guilty on count 3 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by Atty Johnson.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
 -Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Count 3

-$350 Fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-5 days county jail - with huber and 60 days to commence.  Out of county service and out of county travel.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 1 year
-AODA

DA has no objection to dismissing the TR citations.  Court dismisses any companion citations.
 
Court adjourned at 10:55 am
State's
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.

1:43 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Johnson and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Johnson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on April 26, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:45 p.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing at 03-29-2016 01:30 pm
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

11:16 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Johnson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 29, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:17 a.m.
for Leave to File Additional Motions
By Atty Erik Johnson
Initial appearance at 02-23-2016 11:00 am

Atty Erik Johnson called, will be representing the defendant and needs to adjourn this matter.  Matter adjourned to February 23, 2016 at 11:00 a.m. with his other cases.  Paperwork to follow.
43
**PROCESSING COMPLETED**
